metadata.title: CVE-2020-12420 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
When trying to connect to a STUN server, a race condition could have causeda use-after-free of a pointer, leading to memory corruption and apotentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR <68.10, Firefox < 78, and Thunderbird < 68.10.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
